intro: Machaeranthera orcuttii, commonly known as the Orcutt's blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange-colored ray flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy leaves and produces small, tubular disk flowers that are less showy than the ray flowers. Machaeranthera orcuttii is known for its drought tolerance and is often found in arid environments.
